title: MEC6015 Project Management | Singapore Institute of Technology

meta.description: This module provides a fundamental understanding of the principles of project management, as defined by the Project Management Institute's (PMI's) latest version of the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK).

text_lines: Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses
Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses

This module provides a fundamental understanding of the principles of project management, as defined by the Project Management Institute's (PMI's) latest version of the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK).

Effective from AY2025/26 Trimester 2 (January 2026), the Postgraduate Certificate in Building Services Engineering will be transiting to Graduate Certificate in Building Services Engineering. For more details, please refer to the full notice

This module provides students with a fundamental understanding of the principles of project management, as defined by the Project Management Institute (PMI)’s latest version of Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK).

Students will learn the concept, phases, processes and knowledge areas of project management, so that students can apply the knowledge into managing their current and future projects using scientific methodologies. The topics include the project management principles, phases, and process groups such as initiating, planning, executing, monitoring and controlling, and closing. The lectures will detail the knowledge areas, including project integration management, project scope management, project stakeholder management, project schedule management, project cost management, project quality management, project resource management, communications management, procurement management and project risks management etc.

Computer tools, such as Microsoft Project software, will be introduced to provide hands-on practical skills with the above topics. Students will apply the knowledge learnt in this module on a serials of case studies and project tasks. Assessment will be through quizzes, individual assignment and team-based project tasks.
Candidates should possess a Bachelor degree in engineering
Candidates must have at least one year of relevant working experience in the built environment or engineering industry
Identify the elements of the project management life cycle
Comprehend project integration, scope and stakeholder management
Optimise results while managing schedule, cost and quality constraints
Master the use of Microsoft project software in performing various project management planning and scheduling tasks
Associate Faculty, Engineering  Singapore Institute of Technology
Associate Faculty, Engineering  Singapore Institute of Technology
Dr. George Qizhi Sun is an Associate Faculty of Engineering at the Singapore Institute of Technology. He teaches project management for the M.Sc. in Mechanical Engineering (MS017) programme.

Dr. Sun has worked with a variety of industries, including manufacturing, supply chain, transport, and services. He has managed projects in planning, proof-of-concept, systems integration, and deployment of emerging technologies to bring consistency, lean operations, and agility to businesses. His responsibilities include the development and management of collaborative research and technological trials for the improvement of reliability, productivity, and safety, as well as the certification for railway engineering professionals.

His research interests include sustainable transport, railway, and transportation engineering. Dr. Sun holds a Ph.D. in Operations Management from the Business School of Portsmouth University, United Kingdom. He is a member of the Institution of Engineers, Singapore (IES), and a certified Project Management Professional (PMP).
A Certificate of Attainment will be issued to participants who:
Attend at least 75% of the module; and
Undertake and pass credit bearing assessment (worth 6 credits) during the module, which can be stacked towards the Postgraduate Certificate in Building Services Engineering
Participants who meet the attendance requirement but do not pass the assessment will receive a Certificate of Participation.
The full fee for this course is S$3,606.88
All fees above include GST. GST applies to individuals and Singapore-registered companies.
